name: Spot, Listen, Blind Fight, and AB
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hello all ECBers

This may be of interest to you as builders. I hope my observation is understandable to you.

Background
I am playtesting the spell-resistant kensai draft I recently wrote, in WoG. I took him to the Moathouse. Used my lovely stealth skills to great effect.

Now to give you context, pretty much every enemy on WoG uses stealth. My main detection skill is Listen, as it is a class skill for Monks, and I had pumped that to max.

I had zero ranks in spot, and a Wisdom score of 8. No items to boost either listen or spot. Listen was going to be the way I could detect a stealthed opponent, essentially with a modified spot score of -1 vs modified listen score of 7.

My AB at the time was +9 wielding a scimitar +1. 

The event
I attempted to attack a bugbear from stealth. 

The bugbear was attempting to use stealth but I detected him, almost certainly through the listen skill.

I noted the AB on my combat roll was +5.

I also noted the AB on the bugbear's combat rolls to attack me was also 4 lower than expected.

Subsequent combat AB was normal.



Aftermath
I was puzzled by this occurrence. I had a gut feeling, for some reason, that taking the Blind Fight feat might resolve this issue. I had gained level 6 so I could do so with a general feat.

And with Blind Fight taken, my AB now behaved as normal (ie +10 from the extra level).

Hypothesis
I believe that because the bugbear was in stealth mode, detected by the listen skill and I did not have blind fight, I suffered a -4AB penalty.

Then when I did have blind fight, that penalty no longer is suffered.

As per the NWN Wiki: Attack Bonus (dot point number 3)
Both melee and ranged
  • Attacker's size modifier. -2 to +2 AB
  • Attacker is invisible or target is blind. +2AB (unless negated by the target's blind fighting)
  • Target cannot be seen (hidden, invisible, or out of visual range). -4AB
  • Target is flanked. +2AB (unless negated by the target's defensive awareness)
  • Target is stunned. +2AB
Discussion
I am curious to what your thoughts are. Do you think my hypothesis is correct, or is there an alternative explanation?

My thoughts are that in modules where enemies use stealth and listen is chosen as the detection skill (for the advantage of detection behind objects and around walls), that the addition of Blind Fight should be considered mandatory. 

I try to incorporate Blind Fight in all my combat builds, but this could be an argument in such conditions where stealthy opponents are going to be encountered early, that Blind Fight be taken as soon as practical, particularly in builds which aim to attack from invisibility or stealth against similarly stealthed opponents.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I agree with your hypothesis: remembering that Listen opposes Move Silently while Spot opposes Hide. Thus Blind Fight is even more useful in Listen-based builds, essentially compensating for the lack of Spot. Obviously, True Seeing is also damned useful, but items/scrolls of it aren't exactly common early on. I confess that given the option of Spot or Listen, I would generally choose Listen (although it depends on the purpose of the particular build) - effectively enabling you to "see" enemies who aren't stationary around corners and through doors/walls - because more stuff seems available to enhance Spot: starting with Blind Fight.

Cheers

posts.author: Luj1
posts.content: Forgive me for intruding, but hypothetically speaking if one doesn't have Blind Fight which should be favored, Spot or Listen?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
With no Blind Fight, Spot allows for no AB penalties against stealthers, can detect enemies from a distance and avoids sneak attacks from stealth (listen does not), 
I would choose that if true seeing is not available
Fine print though, in practice it only makes a small difference perhaps
If listen is a class skill for your build and spot is not, then choose listen for sure

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Here is something else about Listen and Blindfighting :
A character will be considered flat-footed if attacked by an unseen creature, unless the attacker is heard and the character has the blind fight feat.
This I find to be even more interesting - one can prevent being flat-footed with Listen and Blind Fighting from many of the "normal" methods used to produce that state (attacking from stealth, invis, darkness, blind, etc).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Oh, I do like that, Web! From a purely selfish perspective, that is, as the vast majority of builds I play are melee-based, and I always take Blind Fight. I also play a lot of Monk-based builds, where Listen is a class skill but Spot isn't, so every bit of your post's a winner!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Yeah, in the environment where I play, TS has been "nerfed" AND everything tends to sneak resulting in lots of situations where one can be flatfooted...

Not to mention all the "cheese" tactics of course!

So I was looking for ways to "nullify" that - and came across that little gem of information.

So as long as one has something in the Action Queue and has high Listen and Blindfighting, one will not be caught flatfooted (of course, getting hit with some sort of spell or effect that causes flatfootedness is something else).  Loosing Tumble and Dodge AC can really hurt.
